Articles.Content:
Well. i Noticed something really weird, only happening with (my) Spaceplanes.

1st: i've built a ssto that is able to reach orbit but while ascending im able to set the warp-factor to 2 or 3 and then, immediately the ship explodes.

(well actually my car doesnt blow up if i drive 100 kmh rather than 50 kmh.)

If the physics engine isnt able to handle the warp then why its allowed ? I dont assume a bug so anyone can tell me why this happens ?

why does the ship explodes at double speed and not at normal speed. Makes no sense, looks like im the first one to report this, otherwise this would have been fixed at all.

2nd: inside my mk3 cargo-bays items start to overheat without any reason and spontaneously explode, while the cargobay itself and all other parts of the ssto stay cool.

this happens even if the ship is already in a stable orbit, outside of the atmosphere. For no good reason at all, because the parts never cool down even with radiators installed.

what did i wrong ?

3rd: while setting warp (at any time) or trying to launch the ship, or for no reason at any random spot my ssto spontaneously dissassembles without no reason. or explodes without any reason at all.

4th: while trying to land the ship spontaneously explodes or dissassembles with no reason at all so a ssto that with no problem (if nothing of the 3 points over here hit) launched just falls apart like small babys wooden blocks. if i touch down slow enough the ship falls apart with no explosion at all just a mess of quite a large number of parts laying around.

I desperately need a guide that carefully explains to me,

what sort of 'looks like it fits perfectly together' game mechanic is not supposed to be used by the player.

The software designers must have published a list what 'looks like it fits' game mechanic shall absolutely not be used togehter because otherwise

really really obvious things like 'fitting mk3 parts together creates a connection' would have been implemented in the game so far.

can anyone please give me a link to that list ?

Im just out of any further ideas because all parts fits perfectly together and crashing in the ground is for me a good explanation for a explosion. but

just out of nothing there is no real reason to explode. things usually dont explode by being put together and being watched at higher speeds, because speeded time itself

only affects the growth of trees but not the behave of machinery (let out corrosion but corrosion doesnt appear in space at all).

(maybe im to old to get the joke in that ?)

actual version i play is 1.04

added screenshots:

wobbling all the way up is fine, adds somewhat realism to the rockets.

but dissassembling like that

and suddenly its like that

doesnt make me laugh.
